content.description: Learn the basics of reading a piece of music.

lessons.title: Staffs and Clefs
lessons.explanation: Gain an understanding of the staff (lines and spaces) and the role of treble and bass clefs in indicating pitch.

lessons.title: Pitch and Intervals
lessons.explanation: Learn the musical alphabet, and where each note lies on the staff.

lessons.title: Note Duration
lessons.explanation: Learn about different note durations (whole notes, half notes, etc.), rests, and time signatures, which are essential for understanding rhythm in music.

lessons.title: Steps and Skips
lessons.explanation: Learn the concepts of steps and skips and intervals (e.g., seconds, thirds) in music, helping you grasp the foundations of musical pitch.

lessons.title: Key Signatures, Majors and Minors
lessons.explanation: Here, you'll explore major and minor keys, as well as how key signatures relate to scales, shaping the overall tonality and mood of a piece of music.

lessons.title: Dynamics and Articulation
lessons.explanation: This topic delves into dynamics (soft, loud, gradual changes) and articulation marks (staccato, legato) to understand how musicians add expressiveness and character to their performances.

lessons.title: Tempo and Other Terminology
lessons.explanation: Here, you'll learn common musical terms (e.g., tempo, BPM) and explore musical symbols and signs (e.g., repeat signs, fermata) to enhance your understanding of music theory and performance.

lessons.title: Basic Rhythm Reading
lessons.explanation: Use the knowledge you've gained thus far by actually reading a basic rhythm together!

lessons.title: Intermediate Rhythm Reading
lessons.explanation: We'll read a rhythm that is a little more comprehensive together.

test.description: Test your knowledge of Reading Music.

questions.content: Which of the following are two types of clefs?
Which of the following correctly lists the notes in the spaces of the treble clef?
Where do you look to find the number of beats in a measure?
Fill in the blank: Flats ____ the pitch of a note by a half step.
A half note gets 1 beat in a time signature with a bottom number of 4.
A skip from C to A would be called which of the following?
Fill in the blank: A note with a dot above or below it should be played ____.
What tool is used to hear the tempo of a piece of music?
How would you play a line of music with a forte dynamic marking in the first half, and then a piano dynamic in the second half?
Which of the following should you do before playing a line of music?

content.description: Find out which music group you belong in, and which instrument to play!

lessons.title: Music Groups
lessons.explanation: Explore different types of musical ensembles such as bands, orchestras, and choirs, and understand the collaborative nature of music performance.

lessons.title: Introduction to Instruments
lessons.explanation: Introduction to various instrument families, including strings, woodwinds, brass, and percussion, providing an overview of their unique sounds and roles.

lessons.title: Choosing an Instrument
lessons.explanation: Explores factors to consider when selecting a musical instrument, including personal preference, sound, size, and physicality.

lessons.title: Choral Singing
lessons.explanation: Delves into the different voice parts (soprano, alto, tenor, bass) and emphasizes the importance of teamwork and harmony, and how to use your very own voice as an instrument.

lessons.title: Finding Your Chorale Voice
lessons.explanation: Discover which of the four voice parts (soprano, alto, tenor, bass) best suits your singing ability in a chorale.

lessons.title: Introduction to Percussion Instruments
lessons.explanation: Explore the world of percussion instruments, such as drums, xylophones, and marimbas, to understand how they create rhythm and beat.

lessons.title: Ensemble vs Solo
lessons.explanation: Learn the differences between performing in an ensemble and as a soloist, and how personal preferences and musical inclinations play a role.

lessons.title: Songwriting And Composition
lessons.explanation: Discover the art of creating music through songwriting and composition, focusing on the craft of expressing emotions and stories through lyrics, melodies, and arrangements.

lessons.title: Music Production
lessons.explanation: Explore the increasing accessibility of sound editing technologies and how they've made music production more popular. It also touches on electronically created music like EDM and the role of music producers and audio engineers.

test.description: Test how well you understand different music groups and instruments.

questions.content: Orchestras primarily feature string instruments, with smaller amounts of brass, woodwinds, and percussion included.
Which instrument family is usually responsible for maintaining the rhythm of the ensemble?
Which of the following are factors you should consider when deciding on an instrument to play?
You need access to an instrument to play in a choir.
Which of the following lists the 4 voice parts in order from highest to lowest in pitch?
Which of the following instruments work exceptionally well as solo instruments, due to their ability to cover both melody (primary part) and harmony (all other parts)?
Which of the following apps is included on all Apple devices, and can help you start your journey into engineering sounds that might be found in genres such as EDM and many more?

content.description: Explore some of the more popular genres of music out there and see which ones catch your ear!

lessons.title: Deep Dive into Jazz
lessons.explanation: Embark on a captivating journey through the lively streets of New Orleans as we explore the origins, instruments, and improvisational language that define the mesmerizing world of Jazz.

lessons.title: Discovering Classical Music
lessons.explanation: Take a timeless stroll through the 18th-century origins of Classical Music, delving into the masterpieces of Mozart, Beethoven, and Bach, and uncovering the emotional depth that marks this enduring genre.

lessons.title: Rock through the Ages
lessons.explanation: Turn up the volume and traverse the dynamic evolution of Rock music, from the rebellious spirit of the mid-20th century to the diverse sonic palettes of classic rock, punk, grunge, and alternative rock.

lessons.title: Exploring the Blues
lessons.explanation: Immerse yourself in a soul-stirring journey into the heart and roots of American music with the Blues, exploring its emotive expressions, distinctive sounds, and rich tapestry of emotions.

lessons.title: Pop Music Unveiled
lessons.explanation: Uncover the colorful and dynamic world of Pop Music, from its infectious hooks and catchy lyrics to the diverse influences that make it a true melting pot of sound, celebrating musical diversity.

lessons.title: Fusion Genres
lessons.explanation: Embark on a fascinating exploration of Fusion Genres, where musical boundaries blur, and creativity knows no limits, experiencing the vibrant clash of diverse styles, cultures, and instruments.

lessons.title: Underground and Niche Genres
lessons.explanation: Venture into the lesser-known realms of music with Underground and Niche Genres, discovering sonic sanctuaries of unconventional sounds, avant-garde experimentation, and the birthplaces of sonic innovation.

test.description: Test how well you understand different music genres.

questions.content: What is one defining characteristic of jazz that sets it apart from other gernes?
answers: Strict adherence to written musical scores

questions.content: What is a common theme in the blues, reflecting its roots in the American experience?
answers: Expression of life's hardships and triumphs

questions.content: What defines Pop music and makes it a true melting pot of sound?
What is a key characteristic of Fusion Genres?
answers: Blending of different styles, cultures, and instruments

questions.content: What distinguishes Underground genres?
Which of the following instrument combinations would most likely be found in a classical music setting?
answers: A violin and a grand piano
An electric guitar and a sitar

questions.content: Which of the following words is most closely associated with Rock music?
